alert.note: Alert for McLennan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 20 at 4:48PM CDT until April 20 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN MCLENNAN AND EAST CENTRAL CORYELL COUNTIES... At 447 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Mother Neff State Park, or near McGregor, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Waco, Hewitt, Robinson, Woodway, McGregor, Beverly Hills, Lorena, Bruceville-Eddy, Moody, Crawford, Lake Waco, Mother Neff State Park, Oglesby, Whitson, Willow Grove, Leon Junction, Spring Valley and Mound. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
